conclusion: To determine the work done by the gas from state B to state C, analyze the process on the p-V diagram.
State B has pressure p_B = 0.6p_0 and volume V_B = V_0. State C has pressure p_C = 0.6p_0 and volume V_C = 0.5V_0.
The process from B to C is an isobaric process (constant pressure).
For an isobaric process, the work done W by the gas is given by W = p ΔV.
The change in volume ΔV from state B to state C is ΔV = V_C - V_B = 0.5V_0 - V_0 = -0.5V_0.
Using the pressure p = 0.6p_0 and the change in volume ΔV = -0.5V_0, calculate W = (0.6p_0)(-0.5V_0) = -0.3p_0 V_0.
The work done by the gas when it changes from state B to state C is -0.3p_0 V_0.
